availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Tilford Welch (Montgomery and Powell County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Araminta Hon Welch. Father of James M. Welch, Laura Welch, Eliza Welch, Sarah Welch, Alice Welch, and Martha Welch. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Member of the Democratic Party. Farmer in Powell County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District No. 2, p. 48B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 19.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, Precinct No. 2, p. 139A.
"Democratic Meeting in Powell County," Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, KY), December 18, 1858, p. 1.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994053, Powell County Births.
"Tilford Welch (1823-1863)," Find A Grave, Memorial 5376334, accessed November 22, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5376334.
